message.content:
cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.GT, cs.MA, cs.SY

Reasoning: 
1. cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) - The paper proposes a framework for learning robust policies in asymmetric imperfect-information games using multiagent reinforcement learning and opponent modeling. This falls under the scope of AI research.
2. cs.LG (Machine Learning) - The paper uses reinforcement learning and ensemble training methods to learn robust policies, which are subfields of machine learning.
3. cs.GT (Computer Science and Game Theory) - The paper deals with game theory and modeling opponents in games, which is a core topic in computer science and game theory.
4. cs.MA (Multiagent Systems) - The paper uses multiagent reinforcement learning to learn opponent models and policies, which falls under the scope of multiagent systems research.
5. cs.SY (Systems and Control) - The paper proposes a stochastic optimization scheme to dynamically update the opponent ensemble, which can be considered as a control problem.
